basics.name: Nadine Fischoff
basics.label: Web Developer, Data Analyst
basics.summary: Full stack web developer and data analyst with experience in Ruby on Rails, JavaScript, R and SQL. I discovered web development through my work with government and policy analysis, and use programming to help organizations automate processes and retrieve, organize, and understand their data. Passionate about all things related to coding, health, and politics, I also developed five iOS apps as a side project while learning to code.

projects.title: Decider
projects.description: Provides guidance in making decisions. Logged in users enter questions and pros and cons for them.
projects.summary: Created front-end with React & Redux; created backend API with Rails and Postgres database; deployed with Heroku.

projects.title: BookCrowd
projects.description: Crowdsources books that other users have read and offers ideas for new books to read.
projects.summary: Used React and Redux to create the front-end; built the backend API using Ruby on Rails.

projects.title: Playlister
projects.description: Allows users to add TV shows to playlists.
projects.summary: Built the backend API using Ruby on Rails, and the front-end using JQuery; used OmniAuth for OAuth authentication.

projects.title: R Package: ProPubBills
projects.description: An API wrapper around the ProPublica API, https://projects.propublica.org/apidocs/congress-api/, for U.S. Congressional Bills.
projects.summary: Developed with R. Returns a dataframe with all U.S. Congressional House and Senate bills and info from the ProPublica Congress API within the argumentsâ€™ parameters

work.company: New York City Department of Education
summary: Use R and SQL to automate the creation of datasets to help determine portions of school funding related to the Career and Technical Education (CTE) program
Use R, RMarkdown, and SQL to automate the creation of reports with demographic, enrollment, and funding data for schools in the CTE portfolio
Develop research documents for the CTE program, with demographic and school performance data
Developed and maintained databases for all stewardship-related data, including donor societies for gifts of up to $999,999, and gifts over $1 million
Planned, managed, and executed ahead of schedule, a scholarship reporting program for major gifts
Managed the accessibility and use of a website that students used to updated scholarship profiles
Conducted financial and budgetary analysis and reported findings to management
Developed and monitored departmental budgets totaling over $400 million
